children.subject: If you think the classes are important, you can late drop the course this semester and take it again next semester.

history.content:
My $0.02: Wait on a decision until eecs classes specify how grading will work. There are a lot of other factors, like whether we can have remote proctoring for finals and how the curve works if there are a substantial number of people PNPing (who will very likely lower the curve). If classes have bins, then you should be able to estimate what your own grade will be and make your decision accordingly.

Also, regarding PNPing for grad school/research, I personally think that PNPing is completely fine. Grades matter surprisingly little for grad schools (if you have a 3.9+ rn you are fine), you will have enough grades in other classes that they can guesstimate your 162 and 170 grades, and for applying for research / grad school, you can state that PNP were due to covid-19.

My $0.02: Wait on a decision until eecs classes specify how grading will work. There are a lot of other factors, like whether we can have remote proctoring for finals and how the curve works if there are a substantial number of people PNPing (who will very likely lower the curve).

Also, regarding PNPing for grad school/research, I personally think that PNPing is completely fine. Grades matter surprisingly little for grad schools (if you have a 3.9+ rn you are fine), you will have enough grades in other classes that they can guesstimate your 162 and 170 grades, and for applying for research / grad school, you can state that PNP were due to covid-19.

children.subject: Sorry, it was just a rumor I heard. Thinking back, I probably shouldn’t have written that there given that it was just hearsay. I took that sentence down. Thanks a lot btw.
Curious, which "prof of a certain class advis(ed) against PNP"?

history.content:
This is a global pandemic. Many institutions are considering/offering/enforcing policies similar to default P/NP for classes this term.

Would you really want to attend a graduate school that didn't take that into account?

What should I do? I have a pretty solid GPA (lower 3.9) and really don't want this semester's GPA to ruin it, so I want to PNP but I'm in 162 and 170 and other really important classes, all are classes that are way too important to PNP. I don't know whether I want to do grad school but I want to maintain a high gpa to keep that option available. Should I just take all classes as PNP, and maybe retake some of them as letter grade in the future? Should I letter grade and accept the B/B+'s? I really don't know what to do.

Also, honestly, not only grad school. Suppose I want to find a research with a professor. My competitor has an A and I have a P. If I were that professor I would pick the A student.

Btw some classes I take in other departments strongly encourage everyone to PNP and stopped caring at all about testing honesty so I'll probably have to pnp that, but I don't want to cherry pick so I have to end up pnping everything.
history.subject: I want to PNP but my classes are too important...

history.content:
What should I do? I have a pretty solid GPA (lower 3.9) and really don't want this semester's GPA to ruin it, so I want to PNP but I'm in 162 and 170 and other really important classes, all are classes that are way too important to PNP. I don't know whether I want to do grad school but I want to maintain a high gpa to keep that option available. Should I just take all classes as PNP, and maybe retake some of them as letter grade in the future? Should I letter grade and accept the B/B+'s? I really don't know what to do, especially I heard the professor of a certain class subtly advise against PNP.

Also, honestly, not only grad school. Suppose I want to find a research with a professor. My competitor has an A and I have a P. If I were that professor I would pick the A student.

Btw some classes I take in other departments strongly encourage everyone to PNP and stopped caring at all about testing honesty so I'll probably have to pnp that, but I don't want to cherry pick so I have to end up pnping everything.
